name: DALL-E

score_rationale.persistence: DALL-E (2021), DALL-E 2 (April 2022), DALL-E 3 (2023). 5+ years of active development. Continuous iteration.
score_rationale.autonomy: Generates images from prompts. Requires human direction for each generation. No autonomous creation.
score_rationale.cultural_impact: Defined the 'text-to-image' category. WALL-E + Dalí portmanteau became cultural touchstone. Launched mainstream AI art awareness alongside Midjourney. API opened vast ecosystem.
score_rationale.economic_reality: ChatGPT Plus integration. API revenue significant. Commercial model via subscription and credits.
score_rationale.governance: OpenAI corporate governance. No community governance. Safety filtering implemented.
score_rationale.tech_distinctiveness: DALL-E 1: 12B parameter GPT-3 variant. DALL-E 2: diffusion model. DALL-E 3: improved prompt understanding. Outpainting feature for extending images.
score_rationale.narrative_coherence: Strong brand: WALL-E + Dalí. 'Creating images from text' positioning clear. Part of OpenAI's broader AGI narrative.

curator_notes: DALL-E launched the mainstream AI image generation era when OpenAI revealed it in January 2021. The 12-billion parameter GPT-3 variant trained on text-image pairs could generate images from natural language descriptions—a capability that seemed magical at the time. DALL-E 2 (April 2022) brought higher resolution and diffusion models; DALL-E 3 (2023) added superior prompt understanding. The WALL-E + Dalí portmanteau became cultural shorthand for AI art. While now facing competition from Midjourney and open-source alternatives, DALL-E's ChatGPT integration ensures ongoing relevance.

evidence.claim: Defined text-to-image category, launched mainstream AI art awareness
DALL-E 1: 12B parameter GPT-3 variant trained on text-image pairs
